title: User query: Plan description from client LLM
log: Create a Wayang plan that takes a text file containing organisation names, matches these names to the organisation table in the database, finds all departments belonging to those organisations, and counts how many “BS-opgave” tasks each operation center has. The plan must group results by operation_center and sort them in descending order. Output your result in a textfile.

operations.table: (SELECT organisation_id, name FROM organisation) as X
(SELECT department_id, organisation_id, operation_center FROM department) as X
(SELECT department_id, task_type, total FROM facttasks) as X

log.thoughts: Load organisation names from text, match to organisation table, get departments for those organisations, join BS-opgave tasks by department to map operation_center totals, aggregate by operation_center, sort descending and write to textfile.

title: Class: PlanMapper Mapped plan finalized for execution

data.table: (SELECT organisation_id, name FROM (SELECT organisation_id, name FROM organisation) as X) as X
(SELECT department_id, organisation_id, operation_center FROM (SELECT department_id, organisation_id, operation_center FROM department) as X) as X
(SELECT department_id, task_type, total FROM (SELECT department_id, task_type, total FROM facttasks) as X) as X
